trans-unit.source: Encapsulates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
<xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> is a simple class that encapsulates a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> for efficiency.
By having a single class that is always loaded, you can defer the loading of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> until it is needed.

Because new classes can be derived from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, you could load a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that could, in turn, load an assembly that is not already in memory.
For a large collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects, this could cause a large number of assemblies to be loaded, which decreases performance.
Instead, the toolbox service deals only with <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects and retrieves their contained <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> only when necessary.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> is designed to hold any cached data from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The default implementation only holds the filter of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, but deriving classes may choose to cache the name, image, and other information.

<xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects support two forms of serialization: they can be serialized through standard runtime serialization, and they can also load and save themselves from a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject?displayProperty=fullName>.
The former provides a very easy way to save <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects to a persistent storage.
The latter provides a way to integrate <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects with mixed data storage formats.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> class from a <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
The containerâ€™s cache of information is filled by accessing properties on the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> for which to create a <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> class from a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref>.
The `data` parameter may contain data provided by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> class.
It may contain data that can be read by one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that have been supplied by the user.
It may also be data with a clipboard format that has a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creator assigned to it.
In this case, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is created on demand.
A data object that represents a <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> class from a serialization stream.
The serialization information passed in by the serializer when deserializing the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
The streaming context passed in by the serializer when deserializing the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> instances are equal.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> objects that represent the current filter for the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.

The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the filter is generated.
Custom creators may contribute to the filters.
This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.
The types stored in a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> may have a filter associated with them.
Filters can be used to restrict the tools that can be placed on designers.
A collection of <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator"></xref> objects.
A collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> objects.
This never returns `null`.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Saves the serialization state for the object.
The serialization information passed in by the serializer when serializing this object.
The streaming context passed in by the serializer when serializing this object.
Returns the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> contained in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.

The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is obtained.
This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.GetToolboxItem%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that represents the data stored in the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer>.
<xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.GetToolboxItem%2A> never returns `null`, nor does it ever raise an exception, except in extreme cases (for example, out of memory).
If a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> cannot be fabricated, the appropriate exception is embedded within a special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method on this special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is called.
This puts the exception at the point of user action.
A collection of <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator"></xref> objects.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> contained in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the underlying toolbox item has been deserialized.
`true` if the underlying toolbox item has been deserialized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> contained in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> is transient.
`true`, if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> contained in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref> is marked as transient; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref> that describes this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.ToolboxData%2A> property creates the serialized version of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The data object can be used by an application to store this <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
This data object is fabricated from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, if necessary.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref> that describes this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer"></xref>.
Merges the container's filter with the filter from the given item.
You should call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.UpdateFilter%2A> method when the toolbox item is modified or configured.
You should also call it if a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptionProvider>, which the changes the filter, is added.
The source of the filter to merge with the container's filter.

For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.
The serialization information passed in by the serializer when serializing this object.
The streaming context passed in by the serializer when serializing this object.
